The correct timeline is: (2) A bar graph labeled "2012 GOP RACE" with Romney at 29% appears under "Your Money, Your Vote." (3) The host announces that Congressman Ron Paul will join live shortly. (4) The split-screen appears introducing "RON PAUL, LIVE!" with a bookshelf behind him. (5) A clip of Senator Jim DeMint praising Ron Paul's limited-government message is played. (6) The interviewer asks Ron Paul if there is room in the GOP for his principles. 

Therefore, the answer is B: 2 -> 1 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6.

The correct sequence is A: 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6 -> 7.
The audio starts with Ron Paul discussing giving a keynote speech and his conditions for doing so, followed by the interviewer asking about his stance on South Carolina defense voters and his potential attacks on MittRomney over Bain Capital. Ron Paul declines to attack Romney on Bain but focuses on policy instead. The host then tees up a question about the Federal Reserve, and a bar chart graphic appears before returning to the studio. Ron Paul批评了美联储经济学家遵循错误的经济理论，并提到格林斯潘在否认这一点。随后，Ron Paul警告说美联储缺乏独立性，并出现了“Ticker Headline”的变化。最后，主持人感谢他并祝他好运。

Therefore, the sequence of events is: Two-shot at the desk with a blue-and-yellow backdrop as the interviewer asks about delivering a keynote and Ron Paul says he’d only do it if he writes it himself. The interviewer pivots to South Carolina defense voters and asks if Paul’s anti-war stance will be a problem as the live split-screen from Clute, TX appears.
